content.text: Dual Degree in Communication Engineering and Educational Technology
I. Guiding Philosophy

The latest educational development spirit of the Pan-Intelligence Federation points out that the fundamental questions of education are whom to cultivate, how to cultivate, and for whom to cultivate. Higher education must fully implement the educational policies of the federation, fulfill the fundamental task of fostering virtue through education, cultivate builders and successors who are fully developed morally, intellectually, physically, aesthetically, and labor-wise, strengthen the construction of foundational, emerging, and interdisciplinary disciplines, and accelerate the building of world-class universities and disciplines with characteristics, style, and ethos of the Pan-Intelligence Federation. The new round of scientific and industrial revolutions is leading to new transformations in social production, with the deep application of new technologies such as the internet and artificial intelligence continuously shaping educational forms, knowledge acquisition methods, and technological approaches, leading to profound changes in the educational business form. Communication engineering is the foundation of disciplines such as the internet and artificial intelligence. Combining communication engineering with educational science and technology can propel the education of the Pan-Intelligence Federation towards higher quality, more efficiency, and more sustainable directions.

The Dual Degree in Communication Engineering and Educational Technology is committed to constructing a program that aligns with the national educational policies and the requirements of the 'Guidelines on Strengthening Multi-disciplinary Training Programs under the Concept of Comprehensive Education,' integrating professional education with curriculum ideology, implementing outstanding talent cultivation with a high sense of political awareness, national conditions education, and a sense of responsibility towards technological policies, excelling in the engineering spirit of the federation, pragmatic and innovative professional qualities, and cultivating engineering talents in the field of signals and communications who are familiar with educational business.

The Dual Degree in Communication Engineering and Educational Technology is student-centered. In the general education phase, it focuses on guiding students to take courses in humanities, history, society, and nature to enhance imaginative and critical thinking skills. In the professional education phase, it emphasizes the combination of core technical theories and professional practical abilities. Required courses integrate the frontiers of foundational sciences in the profession, while elective courses focus on the integration of professional domain knowledge and interdisciplinary scientific knowledge with the characteristics of broad education integration and intelligent education, characterized by application, innovation, intersection, and integration, to cultivate innovative, compound, and applied talents with backgrounds in information and communication fields and education.

The second classroom guides students to pay attention to the development and needs of the world and the federation in the new era, personal career planning, and life values, improving expression and communication skills through various forms of activities, expanding horizons, and establishing innovation and entrepreneurship awareness through participation in scientific and technological innovation projects, competitions, and corporate internships.
II. Educational Objectives

The talent cultivation objectives of this program are: Based on the advantages of Lifelong Agent University in electronic information technology and education, aligning with the development trends of the educational informatization industry, to cultivate compound talents in the educational informatization industry with moral, intellectual, physical, aesthetic, and labor development, general, robust, and specialized professional skills, and comprehensive qualities including national sentiment, international vision, physical and mental health, systematic thinking, and engineering spirit. The educational informatization industry discovers problems in education and teaching from the perspective of the internet, designs data collection and analysis methods related to education, utilizes emerging technologies such as 5G and artificial intelligence for autonomous and adaptive knowledge, conducts software and hardware development, system integration, and ultimately forms new educational and teaching methods to enhance educational and teaching efficiency. After at least 3-5 years of cultivation and accumulation, they can become innovative and compound professional talents in the educational informatization industry.

items: Cultivate professional technical talents who are patriotic and school-loving, serve society, have健全人格, and possess a strong sense of social responsibility and practice the core civic values;

Master the foundational knowledge of communication engineering, understand the principles and methods of circuits, signals, systems, and artificial intelligence, and possess the ability to build application systems from related data collection, transmission to intelligent processing; master the foundational knowledge of educational science, and be able to identify problems in current teaching methods based on the knowledge acquired;

Have the ability to use hardware and software to implement specific algorithm design systems, and be proficient in using modern development tools to design teaching systems to solve problems and serve teaching needs;
Possess the awareness of lifelong learning, the ability to self-learn, and develop the self-discipline habit of learning;

Be able to adapt to the changes of the times and science and technology, and after graduation, be able to adapt to new work and learning environments, becoming technical backbones supporting the modernization of educational technology in the Pan-Intelligence Federation.

content.text: III. Graduation Requirements

On the basis of mastering theoretical knowledge, conduct technical training in circuit design, signal processing, teaching system design, and other fields, as well as engineering practice and scientific exploration. Graduates should meet a total of 12 requirements in knowledge, technology, and ability, as detailed below:

items: 1. Engineering Knowledge: Master the basic and professional knowledge of mathematics, natural sciences, and communication engineering, and be able to apply them to solve complex information and communication engineering problems.

2. Problem Analysis: Be able to apply the basic principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering science to identify, articulate, and analyze complex engineering problems in educational science and technology through literature research to obtain valid conclusions.

3. Design/Development of Solutions: Comprehensively analyze the fundamental nature of problems encountered in the process of educational modernization, flexibly select appropriate methods, embody educational ideas and innovative awareness in the design process, and design teaching systems, circuit systems, and intelligent information processing systems that meet specific needs.

4. Research: Be able to conduct research on basic and complex engineering problems in educational science and technology, as well as information and communication engineering, based on scientific principles and methods, including designing experiments, analyzing and interpreting data, and ultimately obtaining reasonable and effective conclusions.
5. Use of Modern Tools: Be able to develop, select, and use appropriate modern tools and information technology tools for complex engineering problems, and understand the limitations of these tools.

6. Engineering and Society: Be able to conduct reasonable analysis based on engineering-related background knowledge, evaluate the impact of solutions to practical problems and complex engineering problems in teaching science and technology, as well as the information and communication field, on society, safety, law, and culture, and understand the responsibilities involved.

7. Environment and Sustainable Development: Understand laws, regulations, and industry safety standards related to system protection and sustainable development, and evaluate the impact of engineering practices for complex engineering problems on environmental and social sustainable development.

8. Professional Ethics: Uphold the Core Civic Values; possess humanities and social science literacy and social responsibility; be able to understand and adhere to engineering professional ethics in practice and fulfill responsibilities.
9. Individual and Team: Be able to understand and assume the roles of an individual, team member, and leader in a multidisciplinary team.

10. Communication: Be able to effectively communicate complex engineering problems to industry peers and the public, prepare academic reports and technical papers, present and exchange ideas, and clearly express or respond to questions. Master a foreign language, be able to read foreign literature in the fields of information and communication engineering and educational science and technology with relative proficiency, possess a certain international perspective, and be able to communicate and exchange in a cross-cultural context.

11. Project Management: Understand and master the principles of engineering management and economic decision-making methods in information and communication engineering and educational science and technology, and be able to apply them in a multidisciplinary environment.
12. Lifelong Learning: Have the awareness of autonomous and lifelong learning, and the ability to continuously learn and adapt to development.

indicators: 1.1 Master the mathematical knowledge required to solve engineering problems and apply it to the study of professional knowledge in information and communication engineering;
1.2 Master the basic mathematical knowledge centered on designing algorithm system solutions, and have the basic ability to analyze and design engineering problems;

1.3 Master the basic concepts, principles, and methods of electronics and communication-related engineering, and be able to apply them to analyze problems such as circuits, electromagnetic fields, signal and information processing in engineering problems.
2.1 Master the professional knowledge required for related sciences and comprehensive applications, and be able to use it for the analysis of complex engineering problems;

2.2 Be able to use literature research and qualitative and quantitative analysis to summarize, generalize, and articulate complex engineering problems and core thinking in the fields of education, information, and communication;

2.3 Be able to use relevant technical tools to focus on analyzing and discussing related complex problems in the fields of educational science and technology and communication engineering, and provide constructive conclusions.
3.1 Be able to select commonly used design methods and processes in the academic field according to technical objectives and demand plans, and carry out complete unit and system design;
3.2 Construct reasonable teaching systems, communication, and information processing systems according to design objectives and solve demand plans;
3.3 Cultivate innovative awareness in the design and implementation of teaching systems and the basic environment and different methods in the field of communication.
4.1 Capable of conducting research and argumentation on the fundamental principles related to the field of information and communication engineering and writing reports;
4.2 Able to define research objectives based on specific problems in the teaching management system and determine research and implementation plans according to the objectives;
4.3 Able to construct experimental systems based on experimental plans and conduct experiments;
4.4 Able to organize and analyze experimental data, provide reasonable and effective interpretations of the results, and draw beneficial conclusions;
5.1 Able to comprehensively use modern information technology tools;

5.2 Proficient in using electronic instruments and observing and analyzing the performance of electronic circuits and information systems, accurately using charts, formulas, and other means to express and solve design problems in digital logic systems and communication engineering;

5.3 Skilled in using computer software and hardware technology, communication protocols, and algorithm simulation tools to complete the simulation and analysis of complex engineering problems, and understand their principles;
6.1 Have experience in engineering practice and social practice;
6.2 Understand the forefront of educational science and technology, the direction of communication technology progress, and its significant impact on society and the national economy;
6.3 Master knowledge related to social, health, safety, legal, and cultural aspects of engineering ethics;
7.1 Understand the connotation and significance of environmental protection and social sustainable development;

7.2 Understand the impact of technologies, materials, and processes involved in the field of information and communication on the environment, and the importance of regulating 'three wastes' emissions for environmental protection and sustainable development;
8.1 Possess literacy in humanities such as philosophy, history, and law, and understand the corresponding social responsibilities;
8.2 Have a healthy body and good psychological quality to meet the needs of career development;
8.3 Possess professional qualities and adhere to engineering ethics and professional norms in engineering practice;
9.1 Understand the role division of individuals in a team and engage in cross-working group collaboration and assume responsibilities;
9.2 Able to communicate effectively and efficiently with other team members and possess a team spirit;
10.1 Capable of speaking in international and public settings and writing standardized research reports and technical documents;

10.2 Possess English listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills, able to read professional English materials in the field of educational science and technology, information and communication engineering, and conduct academic exchanges with peers at home and abroad;
11.1 Understand basic knowledge of enterprise management in the field of educational science and technology, information and communication engineering;
11.2 In the product development and technical research of teaching management systems and communication engineering, apply management and economics knowledge to carry out project management;
12.1 Understand the importance of lifelong learning and innovative activities and apply learning to work and study;

12.2 Possess the knowledge base for lifelong learning, able to adopt appropriate learning methods according to the needs of social development, and self-improve to achieve synchronous development of individuals and society;

content.text: V. Course Structure and Credit Requirements
(1) Credit Allocation in the Course System:

items: 1. Total Credits: 180.
2. Public Required Courses Module: 34 credits, accounting for 18.9%.
3. General Education Courses Module: 8 credits, accounting for 4.4%.
4. Basic Courses Module: Discipline Basic Courses 23.5 credits and Major Basic Courses 58.5 credits, totaling 82 credits, accounting for 45.6%.

5. Major Cultivation Courses Module: Major Core Courses 12.5 credits, Experimental and Practical Courses 6 credits, Major Practical Courses 4 credits, Major Education Courses 7 credits, and Major Elective Courses 26.5 credits, totaling 56 credits, accounting for 31.1%.

In the Public Required Courses Module, Basic Courses Module, and Major Cultivation Courses Module, in-class practice 13 credits, experiments 26.5 credits, internships 3 credits, computer practice 2.5 credits, innovation and entrepreneurship practice 3 credits, graduation thesis 6 credits, accounting for 30% of the total credits.
Communication Engineering related courses 51 credits, Educational Technology related courses 18 credits, integrated practical courses 16 credits, totaling 85 credits, accounting for 47.2%.

content.text: (2) Study Recommendations

items: 1. Complete the credit course requirements specified in the academic program and meet the standards of the cultivation education program to graduate.

2. It is recommended that students take no more than 65 credits and no less than 45 credits in the first and second years, and no more than 45 credits and no less than 25 credits in the third and fourth years.

3. Complete 2 credits of labor education courses to meet the standards: by taking major required courses (Electronic Design Practice Basics), "Metalworking Practice and Practice" courses, elective courses in the Labor and Creation module, and participating in innovation and entrepreneurship, subject competitions, project practices recognized by the university for credits.

4. Duration of Study: Four years, maximum study period: Six years (including leave of absence). Those who meet the conditions for dual bachelor's degrees can obtain a Bachelor of Engineering and a Bachelor of Science.

5. The physical health test score and grade at the time of graduation are evaluated based on 50% of the total score of the physical health test in the graduation year and 50% of the average score of the total scores in other years. Those who fail to achieve a score of 50 will be treated as completing their studies and issued a completion certificate.

6. Major core courses are divided into 3 course groups (Hardware Design Course Group, Algorithm Design Course Group, and Communication System Course Group). Students are required to choose any 2 course groups as compulsory, but must complete the required number of courses.
Hardware Design Course Group: Digital System Design and FPGA (2 credits) High-Frequency Circuit Design and Practice (2.5 credits)
Advanced Module Circuit Design and Practice (2 credits) Algorithm Design Course Group: Image Processing and Analysis (3 credits) Artificial Intelligence Theory and Practice (4 credits)
Communication System Course Group: Communication Principles III: Digital Communication (3.5 credits) Mobile Communication (2.5 credits)

7. Major practical courses are divided into 3 course groups (Hardware Design Practice Course Group, Algorithm Design Practice Course Group, and Communication System Practice Course Group). Students are required to choose any 1 course group as compulsory, but must complete the required number of courses.

Hardware Design Practice Course Group: Analog Circuit Wireless Comprehensive Experiment (1.5 credits) Digital Logic Circuit Comprehensive Experiment (1 credit) Embedded System Design and Practice (1.5 credits) Algorithm Design Practice Course Group: Large-Scale Foundation and Practice (2 credits)

content.text: Microelectronics Science and Engineering Program
I. Guiding Ideology

Integrated circuit technology is a key technology for national development, a national treasure, and one of the current bottleneck technologies of the Pan-Intelligence Federation. The Microelectronics Science and Engineering Program closely follows the 'Guidelines for Formulating Professional Training Programs Under the Concept of Comprehensive Talent Cultivation', implements the educational policies and concepts of the Pan-Intelligence Federation, integrates professional education with ideological and political education, implements moral education to enlighten wisdom, and places the responsibility of cultivating talents with national sentiment, the sense of responsibility to serve the country with technology, the craftsman spirit of excellence, and the professional confidence of pragmatic innovation in the field of integrated circuit technology engineering talents.

The Microelectronics Science and Engineering Program is student-centered, with a focus on general education, guiding students to take courses in humanities, history, society, and aesthetic education, enhancing moral thinking and critical thinking skills; in professional education, it emphasizes the combination of solid mathematical and physical knowledge with the improvement of professional practical abilities. Required courses integrate current technology with future prospects, through the leap of artificial intelligence capability thinking education, gradually realizing the comprehensive opening of education. Elective courses freely choose interdisciplinary education knowledge in the field of embedded systems, characterized by the integration of industry and education and intelligent education, with application, innovation, intersection, and integration as features, to cultivate innovative, compound, and applied talents in the field of integrated circuits.

Strengthen the integration of industry and education, enrich the first classroom, guide students to pay attention to and think about the development needs of the Pan-Intelligence Federation and the era, individual career planning and life value, and innovative forms, achieve top-level micro-school training base favorable communication skills, broaden horizons, and establish innovation and entrepreneurship awareness through participation in science and technology innovation projects, technology competitions, and corporate internships.
II. Training Objectives

Combine theoretical knowledge with technical practice, current technology with future development, professional technology with interdisciplinary knowledge, to cultivate outstanding engineering talents with solid professional foundations and innovative and entrepreneurial awareness and abilities in the core technology field of microelectronics, with critical thinking, innovative thinking, and capabilities.

Cultivate students to have a solid foundation in mathematics and physics, master core theoretical knowledge, use general technical tools in the industry to conduct experiments and engineering practices in key technology fields, have outstanding professional theories and technical foundations in the fields of integrated circuit technology, device and chip design, be able to engage in scientific research, technology research and development, engineering design and project management in the field of microelectronics and integrated circuits, and expand career development space with strong self-learning and lifelong learning abilities.

items: Have noble professional ethics and literacy, emphasize the awareness and ability of innovation;
Have good team spirit and the ability to cooperate and communicate, coordination and management skills;

Master solid mathematical and physical foundations, master semiconductor process flow and device analysis, integrated circuit design analysis and simulation verification and other related fields of electronic theoretical knowledge and technical tools;

Have the ability to engage in technology research and development, engineering design and project management in the field of microelectronics science and engineering, and have the ability to continue to study for master's/doctoral degrees in high-level universities at home and abroad;
Have the international vision and potential based on school-enterprise cooperation, and the ability to quickly adapt to cutting-edge technology hotspots and develop industrialization.

content.text: III. Graduation Requirements

On the basis of mastering theoretical knowledge, carry out technical training in the fields of semiconductor devices and manufacturing processes, integrated circuit design and analysis, and intelligent sensors. Up to graduation requirements and technical literacy, graduates should meet 12 requirements in the direction of knowledge, technology, and ability, as follows:

items: Engineering knowledge: Be able to identify, express, and analyze complex engineering problems through literature research based on the basic principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

content.text: Complex microelectronics engineering problems, to obtain effective conclusions.

items: 3. Design / Development of Solutions: Ability to design solutions for complex microelectronics engineering problems, design systems, units (components), or process flows that meet specific needs, and demonstrate innovative thinking in the design process, considering social, health, safety, legal, cultural, and environmental factors.

4. Research: Ability to conduct research on complex microelectronics engineering problems based on scientific principles and methods, including designing experiments, analyzing and interpreting data, and synthesizing information to draw reasonable and effective conclusions.

5. Use of Modern Tools: Ability to develop, select, and use appropriate technologies, resources, modern engineering tools, and information technology tools for complex microelectronics engineering problems, including prediction and simulation of such problems, and understanding their limitations.

6. Engineering and Society: Ability to conduct reasonable analysis based on background knowledge in electronics and information engineering, evaluate the impact of professional engineering practices and solutions to complex engineering problems in microelectronics on society, health, safety, law, and culture, and understand the responsibilities involved.

7. Environment and Sustainable Development: Ability to understand and evaluate the impact of engineering practices for complex microelectronics engineering problems on environmental and social sustainable development.

8. Professional Ethics: Possess humanistic and social scientific literacy, social responsibility, and the ability to understand and adhere to professional ethics in microelectronics engineering practice, fulfilling responsibilities.
9. Individual and Team: Ability to assume the roles of an individual, team member, and leader in a multidisciplinary team.

10. Communication: Ability to effectively communicate and exchange ideas with industry peers and the public on complex microelectronics engineering issues, including writing reports and design documents, making presentations, clearly expressing or responding to instructions, and possessing a certain international perspective to communicate and exchange in multicultural contexts.
11. Project Management: Understand and master management principles and economic decision-making methods in the field of electronic engineering, and apply them in multidisciplinary environments.
12. Lifelong Learning: Possess the awareness of autonomous and lifelong learning, and the ability to continuously learn and adapt to development.

indicators: 1.1 Ability to integrate concepts from mathematics, physics, and other natural sciences into engineering problems in the field of electronic information, providing appropriate descriptions;

1.2 Ability to integrate knowledge and solution methods from mathematics, physics, and other natural sciences to analyze and solve microelectronics engineering problems such as electronic circuits, solid-state device physics, and semiconductor devices;

1.3 Understand the relationship between device physics and the principles of semiconductor devices and integrated circuits, and apply this understanding to analyze and solve microelectronics engineering problems;

1.4 While mastering knowledge of devices and integrated circuits, learn the latest analysis and design tools from the global industry, and use these tools for device testing, analysis, integrated circuit testing, analysis, design, and post-layout simulation, verifying predefined microelectronics engineering problems.

2.1 Ability to use mathematics, physics, and other natural sciences, computer-aided simulation, and microelectronics engineering knowledge to analyze and judge the necessity and methods of solving engineering problems;
2.2 Ability to summarize and generalize multiple solutions to complex engineering problems in the microelectronics field through literature review and reading analysis;
2.3 Ability to use basic principles of natural sciences, computer science, and microelectronics science to establish and solve the rationality of complex engineering problems;
2.4 Ability to use technical tools to optimize design arguments for problems caused by devices, integrated circuits, and integrated circuits, combined with effectiveness evaluation.
3.1 Ability to design and analyze based on specific research objectives of model devices, devices, integrated circuits, and integrated applications;
3.2 Ability to select industry-standard design processes and process models according to design objectives, requiring adherence to specific innovative processes and design optimization;

4.1 Master mathematical tools for researching and solving complex problems, and master industry-standard methods for semiconductor processes, device and integrated circuit design, and integrated application development;
4.2 Master conventional testing methods and data analysis techniques for semiconductor materials, devices, and integrated circuits;
4.3 Ability to comprehensively use various tools to carry out material, device, circuit, and system design as specified;
4.4 Ability to clearly list quantitative theories and technical methods in the design process, and obtain reasonable and effective conclusions through comparison of test and load data.

5.1 Learn and master the use of professional tools such as engineering mathematical theorems, semiconductor process and device simulation design, semiconductor device parameter extraction, and digital/analog integrated circuit design.

5.2 Be able to use tools to conduct numerical simulation and design in the fields of semiconductor physics, semiconductor devices and processes, and integrated circuits, and analyze the sources and causes of errors in design work through experimental data comparison.
5.3 Be able to master the use methods and applicable scope of script files used in various subjects.

5.4 Understand the sources of visual domain information and symbols, and be able to use methods such as online queries and literature retrieval to obtain graphic recognition and understand global technology hotspots and trends.

6.1 Understand the development history of electronic technology, especially the integrated circuit industry, analyze the huge impact of society and culture through case studies, and analyze the importance of skills and safety production through historical events.
6.2 Learn and master knowledge related to society, health, safety, law, and culture in the fields of integrated circuit manufacturing principles and integrated circuit design.

6.3 Understand the forefront of technological development from an international perspective, the direction of industry progress and its impact on the social economy, and have a sense of responsibility and mission.
7.1 Understand the past, present, and future development trends of electronic technology, especially the integrated circuit industry, and its possible impact on humans and society.

7.2 Understand the main gases, liquids, and materials involved in integrated circuit manufacturing, and understand the importance of so-called 'three wastes' emissions for environmental and sustainable development.
7.3 Conduct detailed research on wastewater and waste gas treatment processes in integrated circuit manufacturing processes.
8.1 Establish a correct outlook on life and values, and be able to correctly understand the relationship between humans and society, and between humans and nature.
8.2 Be able to understand the professional characteristics and social responsibilities of engineers in the modern electronic field.
8.3 Understand the professional ethics that need to be followed in integrated circuit manufacturing and design, establish a sense of responsibility, and actively fulfill it.
9.1 Understand the beliefs and responsibilities of teamwork in the fields of electronic manufacturing, design, and research and development.
9.2 Be able to communicate with peers and other members, exchange business models, and have a team spirit.
10.1 Have good oral expression and communication skills.
10.2 Have good written expression and narrative skills, and be able to standardize the writing of research reports and technical documents.

10.3 Have English listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills, be able to read professional English materials in the field of integrated circuits, and communicate with foreign peers in listening and speaking.
11.1 Understand the basic knowledge of enterprise management in the field of electronic engineering.
11.2 In the product development and new technology research and development of microelectronic engineering, use relevant theoretical knowledge of management to carry out project management.
12.1 Through the setting of core courses for independent learning, improve the confidence and ability of independent learning.
12.2 Combine the industrial technology progress roadmap and future development trends, recognize the importance of lifelong learning and innovation activities, and implement them in work.
12.3 Pay attention to the development trends and markets of science and technology, and strive to have the ability to adapt to development and even lead development.

content.title: Relationship Matrix Between Graduation Requirements and Training Objectives

content.text: V. Course Structure and Credit Requirements

Credit allocation in the course system:
1. Total credits: 150.5.
2. Compulsory public courses: 36 credits, accounting for 23.92%.
3. General education courses: 8 credits, accounting for 5.32%.
4. Basic disciplinary courses: 23 credits, accounting for 15.28%.
5. Professional education courses: 83.5 credits, accounting for 55.48%.
Among compulsory public courses, basic disciplinary courses, and professional education courses, practical courses account for 47.5 credits, making up 31.56%. (Specifically including: in-class practice 15 credits; experiments 23 credits; innovation and entrepreneurship practice 2 credits; internship 1 credit; computer practice 0.5 credits; graduation thesis 6 credits.)

(II) Study requirements:
1. Completion of the credit course requirements specified in the academic program and the achievement of the educational development program standards are required for graduation.
2. It is recommended that students take no more than 36 credits and no less than 20 credits in their first and second years. In the third and fourth years, no more than 34 credits and no less than 15 credits.
3. Completion of a 2-credit labor and creation module course is required. Methods to obtain: ① Take a 2-credit public labor education course in the 'Labor and Creation' module; ② Obtain 2 credits of innovation and entrepreneurship credits to offset the 2-credit labor education course requirement; ③ Take an online MOOC on labor education and participate in labor education practice, meeting the relevant requirements.
4. Students must pass the physical health test at the time of graduation. The assessment is based on 50% of the total score of the physical health test in the graduation year plus the average score of 50% from other years. Those who score less than 50 points will be processed as completion or withdrawal.
5. Duration of study: four years, minimum study period: six years (including leave of absence); those who meet the conditions for bachelor's degree conferral will be awarded a Bachelor of Engineering degree.
